title: Add desert decorations
description: Spawn cactuses and bones randomly in desert terrain

title: Initialize Cargo project with Macroquad
description: Set up Cargo.toml with macroquad dependency, create src/main.rs with basic async main

title: Implement armor-based appearance
description: Player appearance changes based on equipped armor type

title: Epic: Character System
description: Player character with movement, stats (health), and the ability to equip weapons and armor. Generic appearance that changes based on equipped armor.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Movement speed: 5 tiles per second
- Starting equipment: Two-handed sword, NO armor (0 damage reduction)
- Player appearance: Simple shapes that change color/shape based on armor
- Health: 50 HP max, regenerates 1 HP/sec when not at max

title: Implement item dropping
description: Drop items from inventory onto the ground

title: Epic: Combat System
description: Melee combat with weapons. Attacks always hit. Damage calculation factors in weapon damage and armor reduction.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Attack cooldown: 0.3 seconds (fast, hack-and-slash feel)
- Melee range: 1 tile (must be adjacent to enemy)
- Attacks always hit (no miss chance)
- Damage formula: weapon_damage - enemy_armor (minimum 0)

WEAPON DAMAGE:
- Sword: 1-10 (random)
- Axe: 5-8 (random)  
- Mace: 7 (fixed)

ARMOR REDUCTION:
- None: 0
- Leather: 10
- Chainmail: 20
- Platemail: 30

title: Add grass decorations
description: Spawn rocks and trees randomly in grass terrain

title: Implement monster attack behavior
description: Monsters attack player when in melee range

title: Create ogre monster type
description: 30 HP, 8 damage, spawns in grass terrain

title: Implement weapon swing action
description: Implement mouse click to swing weapon. Attack cooldown: 0.3 seconds. Show visual feedback for swing (arc or animation). Attacks always hit enemies within 1 tile range. Must work with isometric coordinate system.

title: Display health as numeric value
description: Show "X/50" text on or near health bar

title: Implement terrain-based monster spawning
description: Spawn appropriate monsters based on terrain type

title: Create base monster entity
description: Monster struct with position, health, damage, monster type

title: Epic: Monster System
description: Six monster types across three terrains. Monsters have health, damage, AI behavior, and can drop loot on death.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Aggro/detection range: 10 tiles
- Respawning: NO respawn (finite monsters, world empties over time)
- Loot drop rate: 25% chance on death
- Monsters attack when in melee range (1 tile)

MONSTER STATS:
Grass terrain:
- Goblin: 10 HP, 5 damage
- Ogre: 30 HP, 8 damage

Desert terrain:
- Orc: 20 HP, 6 damage
- Wyrm: 50 HP, 10 damage

Snow terrain:
- Snow Goblin: 10 HP, 5 damage
- Snow Ogre: 30 HP, 8 damage

title: Implement inventory toggle with I key
description: Press I to open/close inventory screen, pauses game

title: Implement item selection and equipping
description: Click item in inventory to equip it to the appropriate slot

title: Position HUD elements
description: Place health bar appropriately on screen (top-left recommended)

title: Implement armor damage reduction
description: Leather: -10 damage, Chainmail: -20, Platemail: -30 (min 0)

title: Create player entity with stats
description: Create Player struct with: position (x, y), health (current/max=50), equipped_weapon (starts with Sword), equipped_armor (starts with None), inventory (8 slot capacity). Include methods for taking damage, healing, and equipment management.

title: Implement weapon damage calculation
description: Sword: 1-10 random, Axe: 5-8 random, Mace: 7 fixed damage

title: Implement 2D camera system
description: Implement isometric camera that follows the player. Handle isometric coordinate conversion (screen to world, world to screen). Smooth camera scrolling/lerping. Resolution: 1280x720.

title: Implement terrain noise generation
description: Use Perlin or Simplex noise to generate biome map. Three biomes: grass, desert, snow. Noise value ranges map to biomes (e.g., -1 to -0.33 = snow, -0.33 to 0.33 = grass, 0.33 to 1 = desert). Scale noise appropriately so biomes are large regions, not scattered pixels.

title: Create player sprite rendering
description: Render player as simple geometric shapes (no sprites). Use colored shapes that are visually distinct. Must work with isometric perspective. Base appearance before any armor equipped.

title: Create inventory grid display
description: Show inventory items in a grid/list UI

title: Track player equipment slots
description: One weapon slot, one armor slot, start with two-handed sword

title: Implement health regeneration
description: Player regenerates 1 HP per second when not at max health

title: Create goblin monster type
description: 10 HP, 5 damage, spawns in grass terrain

title: Create snow terrain rendering
description: White/blue ground tile rendering for snow biome areas

title: Add snow decorations
description: Spawn snowy rocks and snowy trees randomly in snow terrain

title: Epic: Project Setup & Foundation
description: Set up the Rust/Macroquad project structure, dependencies, and basic game loop. This is the foundation everything else builds on.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Visual style: Simple shapes/primitives (colored rectangles, circles, triangles)
- Camera: Isometric perspective (like Diablo 1/2)
- Window resolution: 1280x720 (720p)
- Death: Game over screen, must restart from beginning

title: Create basic game loop structure
description: Implement init, update, draw phases in the main game loop

title: Implement smooth terrain blending
description: Gradual color/texture transitions at biome boundaries instead of hard edges

title: Implement player death
description: When player health reaches 0, trigger game over state. Show game over screen with option to restart. Restart means fresh game - reset player position, health, equipment to starting state (sword, no armor), regenerate world and monsters.

title: Create armor item types
description: Leather, Chainmail, Platemail structs with damage reduction values

title: Create grass terrain rendering
description: Green ground tile rendering for grass biome areas

title: Create snow ogre monster type
description: 30 HP, 8 damage, spawns in snow terrain

title: Implement WASD movement
description: Player moves with WASD or arrow keys at 5 tiles per second. Movement must account for isometric coordinate system (up-left, up-right, down-left, down-right feel). Smooth movement with delta time. No diagonal speed boost (normalize diagonal movement).

title: Epic: UI System
description: Game UI including health bar with numeric display (0/50), inventory screen, and any other HUD elements.

title: Set up input handling foundation
description: Basic input polling for keyboard and mouse that other systems can use

title: Implement loot drops on death
description: When a monster dies, 25% chance to drop an item. Drop can be any weapon (sword, axe, mace) or any armor (leather, chainmail, platemail) with equal probability. Item appears on ground at monster death location.

title: Set up module structure
description: Create module files for world, player, combat, inventory, monsters, ui

title: Create wyrm monster type
description: 50 HP, 10 damage, spawns in desert terrain

title: Style health bar with colors
description: Green when healthy, yellow when damaged, red when critical

title: Implement monster chase AI
description: Monsters detect player within 10 tile radius. When player detected, monster moves toward player. Use simple pathfinding or direct movement. Monster speed should be slightly slower than player (4 tiles/sec vs player 5 tiles/sec) to allow escape.

title: Epic: Inventory & Equipment System
description: Inventory UI (opened with 'i' key), equipment slots for weapon and armor, item pickup and management.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Inventory size: 8 slots (small, forces strategic choices)
- Items: Only weapons and armor (no consumables, no misc items)
- Pickup: Walk over items on ground to collect
- Equipment slots: 1 weapon slot, 1 armor slot

title: Implement ground item pickup
description: Walk over items on ground to pick them up

title: Create item tooltips
description: Hover over items to see stats (damage for weapons, reduction for armor)

title: Create inventory data structure
description: Inventory struct with 8 item slots. Items can only be weapons or armor. Methods: add_item (returns false if full), remove_item, get_item, is_full, count. Consider using Option<Item> array or Vec with capacity.

title: Create weapon item types
description: Sword, Axe, Mace structs with their damage properties

title: Implement chunk-based world loading
description: Load/unload world chunks as player moves for performance

title: Create orc monster type
description: 20 HP, 6 damage, spawns in desert terrain

title: Create melee hit detection
description: Detect enemies within weapon swing arc/range

title: Create health bar UI component
description: Visual health bar showing current/max health

title: Create desert terrain rendering
description: Sandy/brown ground tile rendering for desert biome areas

title: Create snow goblin monster type
description: 10 HP, 5 damage, spawns in snow terrain

title: Epic: World Generation System
description: Procedurally generated world with three terrain types (grass, desert, snow) that blend smoothly into each other. Each terrain has unique decorative objects.
notes:
DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Visual style: Simple colored shapes for terrain and decorations
- Isometric rendering (diamond-shaped tiles)
- Terrain blending: Gradual color transitions at biome boundaries

TERRAINS:
- Grass: Green base, decorations = rocks (gray), trees (green/brown)
- Desert: Sandy/tan base, decorations = cactuses (green), bones (white)
- Snow: White/light blue base, decorations = snowy rocks (white/gray), snowy trees (white/green)
